history.content:
There are A TON of internships still open.. check handshake! 

I would suggest CS 188 or CS 189 for the projects, which could help your resume if needed.

children.subject:
+1

Last year I applied for a summer internship in March, and still got it, so it's still possible.
(however it was research not industry, and it wasn't in an area I was interested in, and the work was very boring, and it didn't pay well... but the way I saw it, better to have that on my resume than nothing!)

thank you so much u all give me hope! I definitely haven't been hustling enough on internships/interviews b/c I haven't felt qualified or didn't want to get rejected, but hopefully I can turn this around sorta last minute :D

+1 to Aditya's answer on not giving up on internships yet. There are definitely still lots of companies looking for interns. For summer research, I'd go with the usual advice of trying to email some professors and grad students whose projects you find interesting. You'll probably get a higher response rate from the grad students than the professors, but it's still worth trying to email the professors as well. For research at other universities, you could perhaps try applying to some NSF REUs, but I don't know much about them. Best of luck!

history.content:
I can't find an internship lol (pls advice) so I'm gonna take classes and stay in Berkeley and try to be productive. of cs160, cs188, and cs189 which combo or solo one of these classes would be good to take during the summer? Should I take any or none of them? I guess I'll also try working on side projects or volunteering if I don't take classes and think about what I'm gonna do to prep so I have something to do over the summer next semester I guess :( 

I've taken math 54, cs70, cs61a/b for my background and am interested in the subjects for 160, 1880 and 189 but is there anything I'll be missing out taking them over the summer and how's the workload? Thanks. Also do you have any advice for looking for research internships over the summer? is it too late? Thanks again!
history.subject: Which upper div cs class(es) should I take this summer?
